page.title: 01Review of Caversham/Sonning
page.content: This area borders the large town of Reading on the north. Part of the area is in Berkshire and contains the residential suburbs of lower Caversham and Caversham Park. These are served by primary schools, shops, churches, recreational facilities and allotments. Reading crematorium and the B.B.C. overseas monitoring station are also situated here. Caversham is divided from Reading by the River Thames which flows from the south-west to the north-east. The river forms the boundary between Berks and Oxon in this area. On the north of the river are large gravel pits in use but leaving space for angling, sailing and water-skiing. There is only one old bridge over the river at Sonning; an additional bridge now seems likely. The remaining area in Oxon is farm land, the chalk hills rising steeply.
